intro: Rinorea cinerea subsp. mahayarii, commonly known as the Mahayarii Rinorea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
